items.title: Health Canada warns of serious health risks after raid of Kelowna wellness clinic
items.description: The advisory comes in the wake of a Health Canada raid at Ezra Healing in Kelowna, B.C.

items.title: Canada's Indigenous veterans faced tough battles — abroad and at home
items.description: Canada marks Indigenous Veterans Day on Saturday, shining a spotlight on wartime experiences that historian Scott Sheffield says was a place where some would find a sense of belonging, away from racism at home.

items.title: An Alberta general strike raises many questions. Key among them are if — and when
items.description: What are the legalities around a general strike? What moves could the Alberta government take to stop it? And if it does go ahead, when should it happen?

items.title: Manitoba Government Receives Report on Future of Technology, Innovation and Productivity
Police Presence at Health Sciences Centre 24-7 to Protect Health-Care Workers and Patients
3 Sask. men reflect on Indigenous Veterans Day
items.description: Three First Nations men from Saskatchewan who served in the Canadian Armed Forces say National Indigenous Veterans Day on Nov. 8 is a time to reflect.

items.title: Calgarians optimistic about city's future, question value for tax dollars ahead of budget
items.description: Mayor Jeromy Farkas wants to cut the proposed property tax increase by "at-least half," as new data shows just 42 per cent of Calgarians feel they get good value for their taxes.

items.title: Canadian ship bound for Quebec City stuck in the Detroit River
items.description: A Canadian ship is stuck in the Detroit River right between downtown Detroit and downtown Windsor.

items.title: Photos: Electronic powerhouses Kaytranada and Justice co-headline Rogers Arena
items.description: The DJ and the French duo combined for a memorable show.

items.title: Drought leaves some Canadians struggling for water as wells run dry
items.description: Drought conditions are lingering across the country and some wells have run dry, forcing people to haul water or pay the steep cost to drill a new well.

items.title: B.C. government fined $759K by workplace safety agency after death of wildfire fighter
items.description: B.C.'s workplace regulator has leveled a hefty fine on the province for two wildfire fighting incidents from 2023, including one where a 25-year-old firefighter died in a vehicle rollover in the northeast.

items.title: Trailer Park Boys actor Mike Smith charged with sexual assault for 2017 incident
items.description: Mike Smith, who plays Bubbles on 'Trailer Park Boys,' is facing a sexual assault charge for an alleged incident on Dec. 30, 2017, and is set to appear in Halifax court Monday.

items.title: Can loyalty and points programs help ease the pinch of holiday spending?
items.description: Loyalty programs can be a good way for consumers to potentially save money during the holiday season, but experts say it's not as easy as just signing up.

items.title: Toronto children’s charity wins big following Jays-Dodgers rivalry
items.description: Los Angeles Dodgers fans donated $30,000 to Toronto’s SickKids Hospital following their team’s World Series win — picking up a trend Toronto Blue Jays fans started during their post-season run.

items.title: Discount grocery stores gaining momentum in Quebec
items.description: A new kind of grocery store is selling discounted food items, sometimes that are near or past their ‘best before’ date to promise cheaper prices for customers. CBC’s Gabriel Guinty shares more on the story.

items.title: Toronto will add over 1,200 shelter spaces for winter months
items.description: Toronto is adding 1,200+ shelter spaces and boosting outreach from Nov. 15–Apr. 15 to support people facing homelessness during winter’s extreme cold.

items.title: Drug User Liberation Front founders found guilty of drug trafficking
items.description: A B.C. Supreme Court judge ruled Friday that Jeremy Kalicum and Eris Nyx had broken the law by selling the drugs to their members, and were each guilty of three counts of possession for the purpose of trafficking.

items.title: Grounded container ship MSC Baltic III damaged by 'extreme wind' and rough seas
items.description: Crews are assessing the damage to the container ship, grounded off Newfoundland's west coast since February.
